intro: Tiliacora bequaertii, commonly known as the Himalayan tiliacora, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the Himalayan regions of India, Nepal, and Bhutan, typically growing in moist, shaded forest understories. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with serrated edges and produces small, clustered yellow flowers. It is often found in association with other understory plants in temperate and subtropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
